tips: Always separate whites, colors, and darks to avoid color bleeding.
Wash delicate fabrics like lace or silk separately on a gentle cycle.
Sort laundry by fabric type to ensure proper washing and drying temperatures.
Turn clothes inside out to reduce fading and protect prints during washing.
Avoid washing lint-shedding fabrics (like towels) with lint-attracting ones (like fleece).
Use mesh laundry bags for socks and lingerie to prevent tangling or loss.
Treat stains as soon as possible for best results.
Use cold water for blood stains to prevent setting.
Grease stains respond well to dish soap—apply before washing.
For ink stains, apply rubbing alcohol and blot gently with a clean cloth.
White vinegar works well to lift deodorant stains from shirts.
Apply baking soda paste to tough stains and scrub gently before washing.
Club soda can help lift fresh stains like wine or coffee in a pinch.
Avoid over-drying clothes as it can weaken fibers and cause shrinkage.
Hang dry delicate or stretchy items to prevent damage.
Clean your lint trap after every dryer use to improve efficiency and safety.
Dry towels and heavier items separately from lightweight fabrics for even drying.
Shake clothes out before putting them in the dryer to reduce wrinkles.
Line dry clothes outside when possible—sunlight naturally whitens whites.
Avoid drying clothes in high heat to extend the life of elastic fabrics.
Wash clothes in cold water to save energy.
Only run full loads to conserve water and detergent.
Use natural detergents and avoid fabric softeners with harsh chemicals.
Use wool dryer balls instead of dryer sheets for a reusable, chemical-free option.
Install a greywater system to reuse washing machine water for gardens.
Air dry clothes indoors in winter using a drying rack near a radiator.
Iron clothes slightly damp for easier wrinkle removal.
Fold clothes immediately after drying to minimize wrinkles.
Use a pressing cloth to avoid shine marks on delicate fabrics.
Hang shirts on hangers straight from the dryer to reduce the need for ironing.
Clean your washing machine monthly to prevent mold and odor.
Leave the door open after each wash to let the drum dry out.
Descale your washing machine with vinegar and baking soda every few months.
Check and clean the washing machine filter periodically to maintain performance.
Don’t overuse detergent—it can leave residue and wear down fabric.
Use the right detergent for your washer type (HE or standard).
Pre-dissolve powdered detergent in water before adding to washer to avoid residue.
Too much detergent causes excess suds, which can trap dirt and reduce cleaning efficiency.
Read and follow care labels to avoid shrinking or damaging clothes.
Air dry jeans to maintain their shape and prevent fading.
Wash wool items by hand with cold water to avoid shrinking.
